org.flossware.jcore.io

Class FileMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flossware.jcore.AbstractCommonBase
      • org.flossware.jcore.AbstractStringifiable
        • org.flossware.jcore.io.FileMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringifiable

    public class FileMonitor
extends AbstractStringifiable
    This class will monitor a file for changes. If the file does not exist, no changes can be considered. A change to a file is denoted by its last modified time stamp changing. Please note under Linux, the last modified date of a file appears to be per second. When determining if a file has changes, calling isChanged() will return and subsequently calling isChanged() will then return false unless the last modified date does change.
    Author:
    sfloess

    • Method Detail

      • getFile

        public File getFile()
        Return the file to monitor.
        Returns:
        the file to monitor.

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Return true if the file being monitored exists, or false if not... The file could be deleted - in which case it technically changed, but there is nothing to monitor.
        Returns:
        true if the file exists or false if not.

      • isChanged

        public boolean isChanged()
        Return true if the file changed or false if not. Be aware, if the file does not exists, its as if the file has not changed. Call exists() to see if it no longer exists.
        Returns:
        true if the file changed or false if not.

      • toStringBuilder

        public StringBuilder toStringBuilder(StringBuilder sb,
                                     String prefix)
        Using stringBuilder, compute the string representation of self whose prefix for computation is prefix.
        Parameters:
        sb - will have the string representation of self appended.
        prefix - is the prefix to be first appended prior to self's string representation.
        Returns:
        a string builder that can be reused.
